main.docTitle: Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Confined Spaces) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: approved breathing apparatus (認可呼吸器具) means a breathing apparatus of a type approved by the Commissioner under section 12;

def.name: CertifiedWorker
def.leadIn: certified worker (核准工人) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who has attained the age of 18 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who holds a certificate issued by a person whom the Commissioner has authorized to certify workers as being competent to work in a confined space;

def.name: CompetentPerson
def.leadIn: competent person (合資格人士) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who has attained the age of 18 years;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a safety officer registered under the Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Safety Officers and Safety Supervisors) Regulations (Cap. 59 sub. leg. Z); or (E.R. 3 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who holds a certificate issued by a person whom the Commissioner has authorized to certify persons as being competent to prepare risk assessment reports; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who has at least one year’s relevant experience, after obtaining the registration or certification referred to in paragraph (b)(i) or (ii), in assessing risk to the safety and health of workers working in confined spaces;

section.def: confined space (密閉空間) means any place in which, by virtue of its enclosed nature, there arises a reasonably foreseeable specified risk, and without limiting the generality of the foregoing, includes any chamber, tank, vat, pit, well, sewer, tunnel, pipe, flue, boiler, pressure receiver, hatch, caisson, shaft or silo in which such risk arises; (L.N. 17 of 1999)
risk assessment report (危險評估報告) means an assessment and recommendations carried out by a competent person in accordance with section 5;

def.name: SpecifiedRisk
def.leadIn: specified risk (指明危險) means a risk of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serious injury to any person at work arising from a fire or explosion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the loss of consciousness of any person at work arising from an increase in body temperature;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the loss of consciousness or asphyxiation of any person at work arising from gas, fume, vapour or the lack of oxygen;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the drowning of any person at work arising from an increase in the level of liquid; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the asphyxiation of any person at work arising from a free flowing solid or the inability to reach a respirable environment due to entrapment by a free flowing solid. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Regulation applies to work in an industrial undertaking—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that takes place within a confined space; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as required by this Regulation, that takes place within the immediate vicinity of, and is associated with work occurring within, a confined space,

section.continued: and the duties imposed on a proprietor or contractor under this Regulation are in respect of work in confined spaces within the industrial undertaking for which he is such proprietor or contractor.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Certified worker and competent person to complete an approved course

subsection.content: Where a person has been authorized by the Commissioner to issue certificates to certified workers, he shall not issue a certificate unless the worker has successfully completed a course that has been approved by the Commissioner in respect of safety and health while working in confined spaces.

Where a person has been authorized by the Commissioner to issue certificates to persons certifying them to be competent to prepare risk assessment reports, he shall not issue a certificate unless the person has successfully completed a course that has been approved by the Commissioner in respect of preparing risk assessment reports. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

When work is to be undertaken in a confined space, a proprietor or contractor shall appoint a competent person to carry out an assessment of the working conditions in the confined space and make recommendations on measures to be taken in relation to safety and health of workers while working in that space.

subsection.leadIn: The assessment and recommendations under subsection (1) shall be in writing and shall identify the hazards likely to be present in the confined space, evaluate the extent of the risks arising from such hazards and, without limiting the foregoing, cover the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the work method to be used and the plant and materials to be used in work activities;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whether or not there is any hazardous gas, vapour, dust or fume present or there is any deficiency in oxygen;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: ingress of hazardous gas, vapour, dust or fume;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: sludge or other deposits being present that are liable to give off hazardous gas, vapour, dust or fume; (L.N. 17 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: in-rush of free flowing solid or liquid; (L.N. 17 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a fire or explosion in the confined space; and (L.N. 17 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: loss of consciousness of a certified worker arising from an increase in body temperature; (L.N. 17 of 1999)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recommendations on the measures required, including whether or not the use of approved breathing apparatus is necessary, to render the space safe for workers, having regard to the nature and duration of the work to be performed therein; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the period during which workers may remain safely in the confined space.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), where sludge or other deposits are present and a competent person considers that there is a possibility that they will give off hazardous gas, vapour, dust or fume, he shall recommend the use of approved breathing apparatus.

For the purposes of subsection (2), where a competent person, in evaluating the extent of the risks in a confined space, is of the opinion that there is a substantial likelihood of a change in the environment leading to an increased risk from one of the hazards referred to in subsection (2)(a) during the course of the work in such confined space, he shall recommend the use of such monitoring equipment as he considers appropriate in the circumstances and shall specify the manner of its use. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

A proprietor or contractor shall appoint a competent person to carry out a fresh assessment and make recommendations under this section whenever there has been a significant change in the conditions of the confined space or of the work activities therein to which the previous assessment relates, or there is reason to suspect that such change may occur, and that the change is likely to affect the safety and health of workers working therein. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

subsection.leadIn: A competent person shall, when requested to do so by a proprietor or contractor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out an assessment of the working conditions that will occur in a confined space for which such proprietor or contractor has made a request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make recommendations on measures in relation to safety and health of workers while working in that space,

subsection.continued: in accordance with the provisions of this section, and shall submit the assessment and recommendations to such proprietor or contractor within a reasonable period of time after the request has been made. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Compliance with risk assessment report and issuing of certificate in respect thereof

subsection.leadIn: A proprietor or contractor shall ensure that no worker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enters a confined space for the first time until the proprietor or contractor—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has received, in respect of such confined space, a risk assessment report;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has verified that such risk assessment report covers all matters referred to in section 5(2); and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that all necessary safety precautions in relation to the hazards identified in the risk assessment report have been taken; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the period during which workers may remain safely in the confined space; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enters or remains in a confined space unless all recommendations in the risk assessment report have been complied with.

subsection.content: A proprietor or contractor shall keep a certificate and risk assessment report for one year after the work in the confined space to which they relate has been completed and shall make them available, on request, to an occupational safety officer.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Safety precautions before work begins
section.leadIn: A proprietor or contractor shall ensure that no worker enters a confined space for the first time unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every piece of mechanical equipment in the confined space, which is liable to cause danger, has been disconnected from its power source, with its power source locked out;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every pipe or supply line whose contents are liable to create a hazard has been properly blanked off;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the confined space has been tested to ensure the absence of any hazardous gas and no deficiency of oxygen;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the confined space has been adequately purged and sufficiently cooled and ventilated, having regard to the circumstances of the particular confined space, to ensure that it is a safe workplace;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an adequate supply of respirable air and an effective forced ventilation have been provided inside the confined space; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: effective steps have been taken to prevent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an ingress to the confined space of hazardous gas, vapour, dust or fume; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an in-rush into the confined space of free flowing solid or liquid. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Safety precautions when work is being undertaken
section.leadIn: When work is being carried out in a confined space, a proprietor or contractor shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no workers enter or work in the confined space other than certified workers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is stationed outside the confined space to maintain communication with the workers inside;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the risk assessment report and the related certificate issued under section 6(1)(a)(iii) are displayed in a conspicuous place at the entrance of the confined space; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the safety precautions undertaken under section 7 continue to be effective. (L.N. 29 of 2004)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Use of personal protective equipment

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a risk assessment report recommends the use of an approved breathing apparatus; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person has to enter a confined space for underground pipework,

section.continued: a proprietor or contractor shall, in addition to the safety precautions listed in sections 7 and 8, ensure that—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a person entering or remaining in that particular confined space is properly wearing an approved breathing apparatus of a type that gives appropriate protection given the nature of the confined space; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: a person referred to in paragraph (i) is wearing a suitable safety harness connected to a lifeline that is strong enough to enable him to be pulled out, and that the free end is held by a person outside the confined space who has sufficient physical strength to be capable of pulling the person out of the confined space.

subsection.content: A proprietor or contractor shall formulate and implement appropriate procedures to deal with any serious and imminent danger to workers inside a confined space.

subsection.leadIn: A proprietor or contractor shall provide and keep readily available in a satisfactory condition a sufficient supply of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approved breathing apparatus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suitable apparatus for reviving an unconscious worker;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vessels containing oxygen or air;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: safety harnesses and ropes; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an audio and visual alarm by which the workers inside the confined space can alert those outside.

subsection.content: When work is taking place in a confined space, a proprietor or contractor shall ensure that a sufficient number of persons, commensurate with the scale of the job, are present who know how to use the safety equipment referred to in subsection (2).

A proprietor or contractor shall provide, to all workers working within a confined space or assisting with such work from immediately outside the confined space, such instructions, training and advice as are necessary to ensure the safety and health of all workers in the confined space.
A proprietor or contractor shall provide all necessary equipment to ensure the safety and health of workers in a confined space.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Approval of breathing apparatus
section.content: The Commissioner may approve any type of breathing apparatus for the purposes of this Regulation and, where he does so, he shall publish in the Gazette the name or description of the type of breathing apparatus that he has approved.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Duties of certified workers
section.leadIn: A certified worker, while working in a confined space, shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: observe such procedures as may be implemented by a proprietor or contractor under section 10;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: observe such instructions and advice and attend such training as may be provided by a proprietor or contractor under section 11;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make full and proper use of, and forthwith report to the proprietor or contractor any fault or defect in, any safety equipment or emergency facilities provided under this Regulation.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: contravenes section 7, 8(b) or (d), 9, 10(2) or (3) or 11(2) commits an offence and is liable, on conviction— (5 of 2023 s. 61)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the offence was committed without reasonable excuse, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, to a fine of $400,000;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contravenes section 5(1) or (5), 6(1) or 10(1) commits an offence and is liable, on conviction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the offence was committed without reasonable excuse, to a fine of $400,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, to a fine of $400,000;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contravenes section 6(2) commits an offence and is liable, on conviction, to a fine at level 4; or (L.N. 17 of 1999)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contravenes section 8(a) or (c) or 11(1) commits an offence and is liable, on conviction—

subparagraph.content: if the offence was committed without reasonable excuse, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and
in any other case, to a fine at level 6. (5 of 2023 s. 61)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when requested to do so by a proprietor or contractor, without reasonable excuse fails or refuses within a reasonable period of time to carry out an assessment of the working conditions of a confined space and make recommendations on measures in relation to safety and health of workers while working in that space as required under section 5(6); (L.N. 17 of 1999)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails in the person’s risk assessment report to deal with all matters specified in section 5(2); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: makes a risk assessment report which is to the person’s knowledge false as to a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable, on conviction, in respect of a contravention of—

paragraph.name: i
ii
paragraph.content: paragraph (b), to a fine of $150,000; (L.N. 17 of 1999)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: paragraph (c), to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (L.N. 17 of 1999)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes section 13(a) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $150,000;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes section 13(b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: willfully and without reasonable cause does anything likely to endanger the certified worker or others, while working in a confined space, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (5 of 2023 s. 61)
